defaultStudents.description: I am a undergraduate student studying Computer Science with a minor in Japanese at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. My journey in my academics has been driven by a fascination with numbers and a keen interest in databases, as well as the study of various languages and cultures. Some of my other interests include community involvement, traveling, surfing, and snowboarding. I am expected to graduate in the Spring of 2025.

defaultJobs.title: Welcome Center Management Assistant
defaultJobs.description:
Respond to a high volume of phone and email inquiries related to campus visits and undergraduate admission
Greets, assists, and directs students and visitors to appropriate offices, services, resources, or classrooms over the phone, in-person, or in email
Answers calls to the main Office of Admissions telephone number using a multi-line phone and directs calls as needed to appropriate offices
Assists in the management and sorting of emails to be distributed to admissions team
Assist in the greeting and check-in of visitors
Maintain a welcoming and professional reception area for the Welcome Center
Assist the Welcome Center Coordinator in maintaining a positive, clean, and welcoming environment
defaultJobs.requirements:
Excellent organizational skills - can handle organizing, sorting, and responding to a large volume of emails
Ability to answer and make calls in a clear professional manner
Must have a pleasant and professional phone voice
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Reliable, punctual and able to work with minimal supervision
Familiar with Microsoft Office, Google Suite; good typing skills
Positive attitude and willingness to work as a member of a team
Adhere to a strict policy of confidentiality
Ability to lift and carry up to 25 lbs
Must be a graduate student

defaultJobs.title: Dental Assistant
defaultJobs.description:
Prepare patients for treatment and maintain a steady patient flow.
Review patient health history, take vital signs if deemed necessary, document in patient record, and assure completion of forms and signatures.
Taking and developing dental radiographs as prescribed by the dentist.
Maintains a sterile and neat working environment according to current infection control procedures.
Make preliminary and impressions of patients’ teeth and pour models and trim casts when needed. Make custom trays for patients for denture procedures.
Prepare and maintain dental instruments, equipment, and supplies.
Understands and demonstrates ability to protect patient privacy according to HIPAA laws.
Other duties as assigned.
defaultJobs.requirements:
Completion of dental assisting, other recognized training program or in office training is required.
A minimum of 1-year dental assisting experience (need to have to be called in for an interview) OR an RDA/CDA certification.
Understand practices and techniques of a dental office setting.
Basic computer skills needed to access electronic dental records.
Ability to communicate effectively with patients, community members, and staff members.
Reading, writing, and basic knowledge at a high school level is needed.

defaultJobs.title: #161 Credit Analyst II
defaultJobs.description: Responsible for analyzing financial statements, preparing loan memorandums, gathering information related to commercial customers, and assisting in the administration of the bank’s credit policies. College degree in Business, Finance or Accounting preferred. Experience in credit analysis, loan structuring and documentation. Knowledgeable of various cash flow formats. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficiency in Word and Excel. Ability to work effectively under pressure and to meet deadlines.
defaultJobs.requirements: Credit Analyst II requires at least 1-2 years of experience in financial statement analysis, cash flow analysis and preparation of credit memorandums

defaultJobs.title: Architecture Intern - Summer 2024
defaultJobs.description:
Support multi-disciplinary team in developing designs, schematic sketches/diagrams, and documentation drawings.
Assist in the preparation of design presentations.
Utilize BIM software as a tool for design drawings.
Prepare presentations, including graphic design and PowerPoint.
Effective teaming within the project team.
defaultJobs.requirements:
Familiarity in Revit, Rhino and/or Sketch-up.
Familiarity with Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator and Microsoft Office essential
Good communication skills and the ability to work effectively with others
Ability to work in an energetic and challenging work environment
Must be able to work remotely when necessary.

Please include a portfolio with your submission.
Education and Experience
Working toward a BA or BS in Architecture, Bachelor of Architecture, or Master of Architecture degree. Please note: We are looking for someone who is currently pursuing an Architectural degree from an accredited school. If you have already graduated, please check our website for other full-time positions that might be more suitable for you.
